oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Seaman 2nd Class Edward Raymond Exum
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This studio portrait of Seaman 2nd Class Edward Raymond Exum was possibly taken in Seattle. A white band is sewn over the shoulder seam of the right sleeve. Thetwo stripes on his cuff indicate his rate of seaman 2nd class. Exum was on active duty from July 8, 1918 to April 4, 1919. He trained at Great Lakes, Illinois, and served in Puget Sound, Washington. He was honorably discharged September 30, 1921. He died Feb. 18, 1967. [See also GWjack026-028]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Exum, Edward Raymond
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
